channel.title: Anderson Research Group @ Cornell University
channel.description: This is the website for the Anderson Research Team at Cornell, where we investigate decarbonization of energy systems through renewable resources and demand side technologies.

item.title: Congratulations to Shriya Nagpal on successful defense of her PhD!
item.description: Congratulations to Dr Shriya Nagpal on her successful B-exam! Post-defense picture to follow. We are thrilled for you. Best of luck on your new job as an Assistant Professor at Pritzer College - the students will be lucky to have you!

item.title: Congratulations to Vivienne Liu on successful defense of her PhD!
item.description: Congratulations to Vivienne Liu on a (well-deserved) successful B-exam! Post-defense picture to follow. We are thrilled for you and can’t wait to see the amazing things you will do at NREL.

item.title: Congratulations to Vivienne Liu on her new position at National Renewable Energy Lab!
item.description: Vivienne Liu will join the Grid Operations Planning Group in the Grid Planning and Analysis Center at NREL as a researcher, starting September 2023. Congratulations Vivienne!

item.title: Congratulations to Dr. Elnaz Kabir on her new tenure-track position at Texas A&M University!
item.description: Elnaz Kabir will join Texas A&M University as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Engineering Technology and Industrial Distribution, starting August 2023. Congratulations Elnaz!

item.title: Alonso receives the 2023 Latin American Studies Research Award from the Einaudi Center for International Studies at Cornell.
item.description: Alonso received the Einaudi 2023 LACS Research Award to support his preliminary field work in Guatemala this summer. Congratulations (and safe travels) Alonso!

item.title: Cornell Chronicle article featuring Shikhar's project
item.description: This Cornell Chronicle article features Shikhar’s work with Dr. Madhur Srivistava (Assistant Research Professor in Chemistry at Cornell) on an app to help consumers save money by helping the utility shift consumption.

item.title: Kenji's new preprint is available from Oxford Open Energy!
item.description: This paper looks at long term climate simulations in concert with the NYS CLCPA energy system decarbonization plan to explore the challenges that might arise in an operational setting over the middle-to-long term. The pre-print is available here, pending typesetting by the journal. Congrats Kenji!

item.title: New paper published by Alonso Alegre Bravo
item.description: Alonso’s new paper explores issues of rural electricity access in regions of the Global South. The article appears in Applied Energy. Congratulations Alonso!

item.title: Vivienne Liu presents at HICSS 56
item.description: Vivienne Liu presented her conference paper A Spatiotemporal Analysis of New York State Grid Transition under the CLCPA Energy Strategy at the 56th HICSS Conference on Maui. The paper is available here. Congrats to Vivienne on a great presentation and to the whole team (including Amandeep Gupta and Kenji Doering) on their conference publication!

item.title: New paper by Shriya Nagpal!
item.description: Shriya Nagpal’s recent article explores new methods for designing networks that are robust to oscillations that may arise from renewable energy resources. The article appears in IEEE Transactions on Control of Network Systems. Congrats to Shriya and collaborators Gokul Nair and Prof. Francesca Parise on a job well done!
